text: Armin Gigović (born 6 April 2002) is a Swedish professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Russian club FC Rostov. Born in Sweden, Gigović is of Bosnian descent. ==Career== === Early career === Gigović started his football career in Landskrona BoIS. When he as 15 years old he moved to the rival club Helsingborgs IF and played in the youth teams. === Helsingborgs IF === In the beginning Gigović played for the academy in HIF and in the summer 2018 he played SM for 16 year olds in Gothenburg, which was arranged by Gothia Cup. Almost exactly one year later, on 15 July 2019 he played his debut for the senior Helsingborgs IF team. He got subbed in at the 75th minute against David Boysen, and HIF won the match against IK Sirius with 1–0. In August 2019 Armin extended his contract with HIF until the end of 2021. Already back then there was a big interest from other clubs in Europe about him, among them Genoa, Wolves, CSKA Moscow and Amiens. On 15 October 2020, the Swedish newspaper Sport Expressen revealed that Gigović and Pontus Almqvist were going to the Russian club Rostov. Later that evening the transfer got confirmed from Helsingborgs IF and Rostov. The transfer fee was one of the biggest in HIFs history and according to rumours it gave the club roughly 2.9 million euros, which the club desperately needed. === Rostov === On 15 October 2020, he signed a five-year contract with Russian Premier League club Rostov. ==Personal life== Gigović's father, Almir, was a footballer from Bosnia and Herzegovina. On 24 August 2020, Armin Gigović tested positive for COVID-19. ==References== ==External links== * * Svensk Fotboll Profile Category:2002 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Lund Category:Swedish footballers Category:Sweden youth international footballers Category:Sweden under-21 international footballers Category:Swedish people of Bosnia and Herzegovina descent Category:Association football midfielders Category:Helsingborgs IF players Category:FC Rostov players Category:Allsvenskan players Category:Swedish expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Russia
title: Armin Gigović
